INTEREST IN MCGUANE

Arsenal's 18-year-old midfielder Marcus McGuane is reportedly wanted by several top European clubs.

McGuane is into the last year of his contract and The Independent say Juventus, Manchester United, Manchester City and Napoli are willing to offer him first-team football.

Arsenal still apparently hope to agree a new deal.

LEMAR MOVE BACK ON?

Arsenal have apparently been given fresh hope that they could sign Thomas Lemar from Moncao.

The Ligue 1 champions have seemed reluctant to sell Lemar this summer, but French outlet Le 10 Sport say they could now be willing to sanction his departure.

Arsenal given major hope of £45m Thomas Lemar transfer as Monaco consider late sale

Arsenal’s move for Thomas Lemar could be back on with Monaco reportedly open to letting the winger leave the club, according to reports in France.

The Gunners have been frustrated in their efforts to sign Lemar this summer and have had two bids rejected for the 22-year-old.

Monaco have sold the likes of Benjamin Mendy, Tiemoue Bakayoko and Bernardo Silva already this summer and told Arsenal that Lemar was not for sale.

However, Kylian Mbappe and Fabinho are believed to be closing in on moves to Paris Saint-Germain and there has been a clear change in strategy from the Ligue 1 giants.

Le 10 Sport claim Monaco are now considering letting Lemar leave in what could be a manic final ten days of the window for Leonardo Jardim’s side.

Arsene Wenger is happy with his squad and is focused on shipping out deadwood in the final days of the window.


However, he admitted last week that he would re-enter the market for an ‘exceptional’ player and Lemar would certainly come into that bracket.

‘We are open to an exceptional player,’ Wenger told Sky Sports. ‘However, just to remind you we have 33 players here and they are all good players.

‘That’s unmanageable so to bring one more player in for the sake of it would be stupid, but if we find an exceptional one, we will do it.’

Arsenal given major hope of £45m Thomas Lemar transfer as Monaco consider late sale

Arsenal’s move for Thomas Lemar could be back on with Monaco reportedly open to letting the winger leave the club, according to reports in France.

The Gunners have been frustrated in their efforts to sign Lemar this summer and have had two bids rejected for the 22-year-old.

Monaco have sold the likes of Benjamin Mendy, Tiemoue Bakayoko and Bernardo Silva already this summer and told Arsenal that Lemar was not for sale.

However, Kylian Mbappe and Fabinho are believed to be closing in on moves to Paris Saint-Germain and there has been a clear change in strategy from the Ligue 1 giants.

Le 10 Sport claim Monaco are now considering letting Lemar leave in what could be a manic final ten days of the window for Leonardo Jardim’s side.

Arsene Wenger is happy with his squad and is focused on shipping out deadwood in the final days of the window.


However, he admitted last week that he would re-enter the market for an ‘exceptional’ player and Lemar would certainly come into that bracket.

‘We are open to an exceptional player,’ Wenger told Sky Sports. ‘However, just to remind you we have 33 players here and they are all good players.

‘That’s unmanageable so to bring one more player in for the sake of it would be stupid, but if we find an exceptional one, we will do it.’

BAYERN WEIGH UP DRAXLER BID

Bayern Munich are considering a move for Paris Saint-Germain attacker Julian Draxler, according to the Westdeutsche Allgemeine Zeitung .

Draxler’s future at PSG is uncertain following the world-record signing of Neymar, and he has been linked with Premier League trio Arsenal, Liverpool and Manchester United.

However, German champions Bayern are weighing up whether to make a €40 million approach to bring the former Wolfsburg man back to the Bundesliga.
